data.headline: S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq, and Russell all hover near record highs despite muted trading and flat December retail sales
bullets: Dow outperforms, rising 0.40% and breaking above the 50,000 mark for the first time
Softer economic data—including flat retail sales, lower employment costs, and Q4 GDP downgrades—intensify Fed rate-cut expectations

Earnings drive single-stock moves: Hasbro soars on strong results, Spotify surges after blowout Q4, Oracle climbs on AI demand and upgrades
Marriott spikes on higher branded card fees despite soft 2026 guidance; Coca-Cola and CVS slip after weaker readings
S&P Global tumbles on an AI-disrupted 2026 profit outlook
